intro: Silphium terebinthinaceum var. terebinthinaceum, commonly known as the terebinth. This plant is a member of the Burseraceae family and is native to the Mediterranean region. It is a deciduous shrub that can grow up to 3 meters tall, featuring smooth, grayish bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by orange or red berries. It is valued for its medicinal properties and historical use in traditional herbal medicine.
